customer_reviews.title: I love running in these because I get no chafing
customer_reviews.text: I love running in these because I get no chafing. Some underwear, cotton bunches up and causes friction burns while running, but these stay right and smooth. I run at home on my treadmill, and it's awesome running in these without other clothing. Does anyone know of shorts made just like these underwear?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for running!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 38 waist with big thighs and the XL fit great. These are by far the most comfortable underwear I've ever had. I started running earlier this year in my daily cotton boxers and on longer runs I would have issues with chafing. Having tried cotton boxer briefs in the past, they would ride up and just weren't very comfortable, I was reluctant to buy these especially for $10/pair. But I'm glad I did. They don't ride up at all, breathe great, wick away sweat and best of all no chafing!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: not very good
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a cheaper version of the Under Armour Boxer Jock underwear. They run around $15 a pair. Quite a lot for underwear. I have found the Under Armour Boxer Jock are the best underwear I have ever owned. I purchased these Adidas boxers as a less expensive replacement. They do not compare to the Under Armour boxers. They cost half the price, but for me were a total waste of money. At any rate, they are just not a comfortable pair of underwear.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: These are great, and more importantly a great deal
customer_reviews.text: These are great, and more importantly a great deal. I've tried these as well as UnderArmor's BoxerJock version. I like UA's a little bit better. They just feel ever so slightly more comfortable, but only slightly. And they of course have the pee hole which makes going to the bathroom easier. HOWEVER, whereas a UA two pack is $35, the Adidas two pack is usually $20. That's a huge difference in price for the UA ones only being slightly better. If you only need one or two boxers like this maybe go with UA. If you want to wear them all of the time go with these as the savings will be considerable!
customer_reviews.author: Skat

customer_reviews.title: Only brand I buy now.
customer_reviews.text: I usually stuck with the Nike ProCombat boxer briefs but I had to make a switch. The Nike ones started to be way too tight and restrictive. I am pretty sure it’s because my muscle mass increased quickly after taking. That stuff is potent. My quads gained a lot of mass so I had to switch to the Adidas boxer brief. These don’t have the tight band around my thigh so the fit is much more comfortable. I’ve since bought another 6 pairs. Definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: seth cole

customer_reviews.title: Fall apart quickly
customer_reviews.text: The look/feel/fit of these is great but one pair made it a few months before it developed a hole in the front, and the other pair made it about another month before the waistband started to separate from the rest of the shorts. I have Champion and Under-Armor boxer-briefs that are several years old and they are still fine but these didn't even make it a year before they started to fall apart. Initial quality is great, but the longevity on these is garbage so I can't recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: somedude

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love them
customer_reviews.text: These had received rave reviews on several third party websites. I bought two packs, washed them, and then tried them on...These are not comfortable across the man bits...Maybe I have larger than average thighs from 10 years of Crossfit, but these are so tight across the groin that I find them unbearable. Lesson learned, don't wash the second pack until you've tried on the first. Athletes beware!
